XIL35b7yAOYBHLsCvBPEGg.text: We're so happy that Pasoli's has taken over the space that was Mandy's! They're serving the same great pizza with allergen-friendly and gluten-free options and some menu additions... but now you can have those pizzas, wings, etc. served up by a friendly and helpful staff and management team. All of the negative comments I had about Mandy's have been remedied. We're pleased to call Pastoli's our go-to pizza place in Squirrel Hill!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. gluten-free/allergen menu

-R_K_qcLtAkHqoVcPZ3Ltg.text: Pastoli's is the BEST pizza I have found in Pittsburgh and I have been searching for 2 years since I moved here and a chef myself.  This is my 7th order from them so far and 1st review I have left.  Very good distribution of toppings on their pie's everytime!  Right amount of cheese that stays on the pizza and a great all-around hand-tossed dough.  Proper amount of sauce so everything holds together.   Many say Mineo's down the street is PGH's best (as I was pointed there) but they are fools, their pizza is a sloppy mess as I have tried 3 times.  Too much sauce, poor quality mozz so a lot of grease, everything slides off your crust.  So, go with a sure bet and go to Pastoli's, you will not be disappointed.

mYUA9DtIu7Hw0Ak3U7RPCw.text: Bad pizza!  Mess you up.  I visited Pittsburgh last week and, as a pizza aficionado, decided to try a few of the pies along the Murray Ave strip in Squirrel Hill.  While the staff was nice, Pastoli does not even belong in the conversation with the slices of heaven at Mineo and Aiello.  The sauce was bland and scarce.  The cheese did not have a nice melt into the crust.  And worst of all - the crust!  It was too thick and VERY doughy.  Cannot speak for their other menu items, but do not go there for good pizza.  Even the chains are better.

YFQqOFUcOPs4pV3JV01DxQ.text: Pizza is always the best, wings are outstanding, I like the Cajun dry rub wings nice and spicey.  Fast friendly service...

hxVEJGgAMTYN8spLydlZiQ.text: We've eaten here tons and really like all of their different menu items.  The vegan and allergen free selections are delicious and have been a godsend for my wife since both of our kids started out intolerant of a lot of things.  We recently had a miscommunication during ordering (totally my fault) and the owner tried to comp a pizza for us.  Needless to say, it was totally worth paying for the pizza I mis-ordered.  Yum!

mNQeOufbAFqL9EIB_htf0w.text: Ordered the 20" vegan buffalo chicken pizza. Let me just say, woah. You get so much chik'n!!! It was mouth-watering. We were introduced to Pastoli's May 7 at VegFest and got the XL Vegan veggie supreme (which, again, AMAZING!). I just love all of the vegan options available, without it being just pizza without cheese. I know we will continue to go here - wish we lived a little closer! Next pizza to try will be the Vegan BBQ Pork. :P

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. As promised, got the vegan BBQ pork pizza. Pastoli&#39;s still ceases to amaze me!! Thank you for your delicious vegan options.
Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pittsburgh Vegan festival 2016 - XL vegan veggie delight!! Mmmmmm.
Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 20&#34; of pure heaven! Vegan buffalo chicken pizza. Amazing!!!

S0b5EacGGpNl76N2f3Cazg.text: I've ordered from Pastoli's so many times that they know my office building! When we (a group of coworkers and I) ordered recently, I got the vegan chicken parm hoagi with a side of fries. They alerted me that their vegan fryer was down and asked if I still wanted the fries.  I loved that they thought to ask!  Everything I've had from them has been delicious and my non-vegan coworkers love their food as well. I think my favorite menu item that I've tried is the vegan BBQ pulled pork. Lots of sauce! The "pork" is juicy and satisfying and the toasted bun has just the right amount of crunch.

a-XVCDYuF3EMhF02xkNIUw.text: Superb pizza place in the heart of Squirrel Hill. There's a few pizza shops on this strip and while some are Pittsburgh staples and others are not this one is a True gem. Not many shops like this one in the city. Their gluten free menu is EXTENSIVE to say the least, and the gluten free pizza is actually pretty good. However, their regular pizza is a True contender to the pizza shops in the city. It's the right amount of salt flavory, cheese gushy, gobbely goop on a pizza. The dough is crispy, yet hearty and the sauce is lite yet potent. It is also a bottle shop, so grabbing a sixer on your way out the door is an option. Highly recommend.

co8CC3eQg9PcH9ZYfW5CDw.text: My girlfriend and I have been sampling the various pizzas on offer in Squirrel Hill.  We've worked our way well down the list, and tonight we finally came to Pastoli's, and let me tell you, we were impressed.    We ordered a cheese pizza in their sicilian style with breadsticks via the online app.  While the app said it would take 45 minutes to deliver, we were pleasantly surprised when the pizza arrived about 20 minutes early.  The driver was polite.  Things got even better from here.  At first I was surprised by the look of the Sicilian style pizza, and a bit skeptical, but a single bite quelled all fears I had.  Put simply: it was delicious.  While the breadsticks aren't going to win any awards, they are as good as I've had from any of the other Squirrel Hill pizzerias.    I would highly recommend this jewel in the already shimmering crown of Squirrel Hill's vibrant pizza culture.  Even our dog couldn't control himself.  I think we're about to go back for seconds -- who am I kidding?  Thirds!

nNnHYnwsXyLE8xqvk0lUrA.text: The pizza is awesome! They also have gluten-free options, including dessert from a nearby bakery.

gD25Ow3x9s4s-2ExlEANRg.text: Tried this place on a whim so happy i did got the gyro pizza absolutely amazing and fast delivery too!

vcNn0ZbQvbnvtyfXKp5aQA.text: On a hunt to find our favorite pizza place in Squirrel Hill, we ordered onion pizza fro Pastoli's. I liked the dough and sauce, not so much the cheese, it was quite bland. This is how Mineo's won the battle!

8QslU7W4HEnO4OeaZO_sZA.text: Excellent gluten free options!! They have great service and I have yet to try a menu item I didn't love.

l_UQg7qWrenfMP593PULVg.text: I ordered a pickup order through Eat24. The food was pretty good- nothing amazing, but it hit the spot. I got the spaghetti and meatballs meal, which was supposed to come with a salad, but I got home only to realize mine wasn't included even though I'd selected the dressing and everything. On the plus side, you get an entire sub roll worth of garlic bread, which was delicious. I'd consider ordering from them again, but wasn't blown away by any means.

vZcqBGwb81hcA7VG_RwkJg.text: Delicious gluten free pizza! Crispy crust, flavorful meat topping. Fresh side salad. Delivered quickly. Loved it.

HsA5HcfZjh2mBOu2Rn37Jw.text: The pizza was great for the most part. We ordered a buffalo chicken pizza with ranch but the ranch never showed up. The order took a while to get here 20 minute past the estimated time. Over great pizza, just a little disappointed with the service

lhl2is0-NjBaCp7A3jOKQQ.text: Never had a disappointing order.  Favorite is the white classic pie.  Their tiramisu is pretty decent too.  Also one of the most friendly employees around.  Laid back atmosphere.  Come here if you want to enjoy good food in a comfortable setting.

hhzNBFedrYGUT--sDgZ9XQ.text: They have a lot of gluten free options!!!  The pizza is very good, we got a larger and still had leftovers. We also got French from that had cheese and bacon on them. The cheese was actual cheese and not the junk nacho cheese. Very god service!  And they have a lot of beer selections some of which at gluten free and they carry Gluutney's baked goods for dessert. I will be going back if not they deliver!

N-Yfc4PGYGU12b2OA_cp8Q.text: The size of the Pizza is enormous the large is enough for maybe 10 people. I ordered a BBQ chiken and the taste was nice. I believe a bit more sauce would make it nicer. The chicken used on it was of a good quality and a lot of it which made it nice.

U-VbwYBUOsVx6jjYSDQWig.text: If you're looking for a nice sit-down place for a simple dinner in Squirrel Hill, but without all the frills of full service, this is the place to go. There are a large number of other pizza places nearby, but this feels a bit nicer and healthier (may or may not be True, but I'll take my chances). The staff at the counter are very friendly, a nice change from what this place was before Pastoli's. I had the pasta dinner, which came with a good portion of spaghetti with meatballs, a pretty large piece of garlic bread, and a salad on the side. Everything was great and the overall value was very much worth it. The salad came with a good mix of leaves, peppers and olives, as well as mozzarella balls, while the garlic bread was super flavorful and fresh. The pasta came with just the right amount of sauce with two juicy meatballs. All that for just $10, and if you wanted you could've added another meatball for a buck.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs dinner

w-vLeA13kHkQA7lFuYpQfQ.text: I have Celiac disease and have gotten sick all 3 times I've eaten here. First time I ordered a gluten free Italian hoagie, second time a gluten free Italian wedgie, third time was gluten free Hawaiian pizza....all times ended in stomach cramps and the all too familiar feeling of being "glutened." I've asked each time about separate prep space and dedicated gluten free areas... I thought my stomach problem was a fluke the first time, because by all accounts there shouldn't be any contamination. I'm not sure if they're using regular lunch meats and toppings without checking? I'm not sure if they could be using oat flour that isn't exactly gluten free? All I can tell you is how sick I feel after eating here. 5 enzymes and a Benadryl later, I will not be ordering here again.

EVRsgbnsbl8fpDzLKBDljA.text: We were on vacation & my son found this gem in his research. Parking is metered (but cheaper than some places). We had an excellent groupon. We settled on the lg Apex predator (4 meat) pizza. Had 12 slices One of my sons got the lunch special of a 2 slice cheese w/ drink for $5. His slices were huge, tasty. Our pizza was very good. Good proportion of toppings to cheese to sauce to crust.  Sure beats any chain pizza! Has both fountain drinks & bottled.

vKRK04yUGlhjbd2Y_bL9Ng.text: Great gluten free hoagies, the buns actually taste like real bread! I enjoy coming in when they have a local artist/band playing and relaxing with a few beers on one of their couches. Great selection of beer and they have some quirky specialty pizzas.

2Fg3uCjXlIsagCdzX8Dm6A.text: I was at my son's apartment and wanted some pizza delivery. Delivery time took an hour, however there aren't many places that deliver in Squirrel Hill. It was 3 degrees outside, but the pizza came in hot - much appreciated!! I thought the chic bac ranch was overall the best tasting.

q4z_IYXjlq1WDlE1ebMdWg.text: I ordered the steak and ranch pizza with an order of zucchini strips. The Pizza had great flavor except it would have been nice to have more sauce or a side of ranch served with it. The zucchini strips were crispy and flavorful with a side of marinara. Delivery was prompt and the food was hot. I'm looking forward to trying other items from this restaurant!

6BkvWjCERhaJaurl73wjjg.text: We ordered a large Scilian Pizza. It was very tasty and amazing, enough for 4 adults! On time delivery.

chqod4JTnpEaV-sS8N192Q.text: We had a very good lunch at this no frills place in Shadyside that serves up gluten free safely. Using separate prep stations and fryers it wa a treat to order up their loaded fries, wings and pizza. The food was tasty. If you are in the market for some good gluten free grub while in Pitt make sure you check this place out!!!!

ge4QcYQiL4KNg0L-mPgtnw.text: Wonderful place! Especially for someone with food allergies. They have a book with what ingredients are in what food item like a crust, sauce, etc. The gluten free pizza is also soy free, but they do have a strict allergy menu as well. They make their own ranch dressing in house which is incredible. I love this place because of the choices that fit in with my diet and also the staff are extremely friendly as well. #soyfreefriendly

l0F7xyKTOg8qPqTVy8oQqQ.text: Been here twice, and neither time were we disappointed.  Even though this place is obviously getting a lot of phone/delivery orders, our pizza came out hot, quick and tasty.  I haven't tried the Sicilian, but others in my party have.  Only great reviews.  Their regular pie is excellent!  Tangy sauce, adequate cheese, soft, chewy, not overdone, crust.  They do sell bottled and draft beer, but the selection is very small.  I believe there are six packs there too.  The lack of drink for a beer + pizza lover is a bit disappointing.  However, it won't stop me from coming back to dine in.  Eat my pie, or take my pie, and go drink elsewhere.  :)  Also, they do have vegan and gluten free options.  Definite thumbs up!

Cuc4iWRxVHwjiLQdyFJBUg.text: After listening to the managers suggestion to call instead of ordering online through the eat24 app, I tried Pastolis again.  I have never had to wait over an hour for my delivery again.  So I recommend Pastoli's without hesitation.  You have to love a place that reads their online reviews and uses them to try to improve the service!

uv5_uq6Lrzw__vmrS1gpVA.text: I recently moved here from Cleveland and am looking for the best pizza place in town. Pastolis was our first stop and it is REALLY good.  The think I enjoyed most was that my lactose intolerant spouse was able to get a pizza with dairy free cheese!  She was really happy with their vegan options as well.  The best in Pittsburgh in my opinion although my sample size is small (2)

OfLvUH_ixjCgamrnGXGIaA.text: We ordered a couple of pies while staying in Shadyside recently for the nearby US Open at Oakmont. Delivery was prompt and the pies hot, reasonably priced and very good. Crust is typical medium, right in the sweet spot between thin and thick. Great option if you're looking for delivery.

P9ad7J7GOxpNURhsyod-7w.text: My wife and I stayed in Squirrel Hill for a week during the holidays for our first anniversary and we went to Pastoli's 3 times! Being a celiac and lactose intolerant, this place rocked my boat. I had wings for the first time in over 5 years! The gluten free pizza was so tasty. The wings were amazing. The fries were good too. Definitely will be here again the next time we are in Pitt.

dNUR-lUf5IhoEKiBW--4kg.text: We've been to Pastolis a few times now and it's fantastic! There's a lot of great pizza around here but when the house hold talks about getting zah we keep coming back! The buffalo chicken pie is great and so are the Sicilian style pizzas.  The service is always great, the place is clean and inviting with a nice selection of bottled craft brews. Interestingly enough, they put French fries on some of here pizzas, it's awesome! Defiantly adds a nice touch!  Eat in or take out, I would defiantly give them a shot!

fTSVdph-vi4dHLKgiM73mQ.text: My eyes were as huge as the portions when the waitresses set my meal in front of me. Yep, two people had to bring me my food because each plate was threatening to topple over. And trust me, I am no stranger to ridiculously large portions. Despite being a short/small girl, I can out eat many people around me (well, usually because I don't eat frequently enough, so my stomach can accompany a lot when I do, and being an extremely slow eater means I've probably digested everything before I've eaten enough to be full).  In any case, I LOVED how colorful everything was when it came, as well as all the vegetables in the side salad (most are just generic croutons and cheese on lettuce, but this had a mix of tomatoes, green peppers, red onions, olives, banana peppers, and mozarella balls on mixed greens).  The penne pasta came at the perfect temperature and texture. The pesto was flavorful without being greasy in any way and there were HUGE chunks of chicken throughout. The garlic bread had a nice bite to it, and wasn't too overpowering. The sun-dried tomatoes were the sweetest I've ever had, and added another dimension to the dish. I really enjoyed my meal, and it was well worth the price. I will be back to try the other dishes, especially the wide variety of calzones!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken pesto penne with thick slices of garlic bread
Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lovely side salad with italian dressing

TUGo7pzN6HvHfUPDBy13ew.text: Very great gluten free options and delicious. There was pizza, pasta, appetizers, wedgies, hoagies, chicken fingers, beer/cider and they had some Gluten free desserts from the Gluuteny bakery across the street (which is also amazing). Quaint environment with nice bathrooms just incase that is imoortsnt to you.  The staff are all very kind and care about you. The only complaint we have was our food came out separate and from the first to our last person there was about a 7-10 minute difference. There were only 4 of us at the table. But the quality and taste of the food was well worth the wait so it wasnt that big of a deal and we enjoyed eachothers company

FvzPt2YgphYw3OYaYxS_rQ.text: Our first time at Pastoli's and it won't be the last. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the establishment is clean. My guy and I shared an antipasto salad with balsamic vinaigrette and a meat lovers pizza. Both extraordinarily delicious. Thank you folks for a nice time. Try it. We're sure you will like it too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yummy

qQpOwR1N8uQA6T9n7w-BaA.text: This place let us watch the end of the Pens game after their closing hours... enough said  good Hawaiian pizza too!

jo4egwHN9xEF8iDBrrPjVQ.text: Hands down the best Pizza in Squirrel Hill area.  The rest are just cruising on past accolades and lets face it don't measure up in 2016.  If you haven't tried Pastoli's you need to.

5DzjeLZijCkHhYPXYsv3Dg.text: We got regular buffalo wings and they hit the spot. Good sized wings.   Fries were not too salty.  Have not tried their pizza yet,

OBjzDNAfgPAqcH9JOKxS2w.text: My bf is gluten free.  He was so excited that the menu offered a TON of options for him!  Food was great, service was excellent!! Highly recommend!

6XL4kWzzgusmWLwzBGq62A.text: I recently relocated to Pittsburgh from the west coast and discovered Pastoli's soon after. I've had celiac disease for years however I hate mentioning gluten allergies to restaurants because they're not dietitians nor should they be responsible for people's health. Pastoli's has so many options that are clearly marked it makes going out to eat a "normal" experience for me. Food is awesome, staff is super friendly and it's a comfortable environment to sit, watch tv, and relax. Thanks Pastoli's!

as20KYQcGl5rkun3EucCpA.text: I am so happy I found this place! I tried their buffalo chicken pizza and it was definitely one of the best I've ever had. Tasty buffalo sauce (spicy but not too spicy), delicious crust, and a good amount of toppings. I never thought french fries would work so well on a buffalo chicken pizza but they really do! Their mozzarella sticks are insanely good too, the batter they fry them in reminded me of something you'd eat at a county fair-so delicious! By far the best pizza I've had in Pittsburgh. I can't wait to try other types of pizzas from them, I'll definitely be ordering from them again and again!

uxEGvMvi6hQbNjqU1BOtGg.text: I have celiac. Having celiac makes it difficult to eat out. When I found out about this place I had to try it. So glad I did. The staff was extra friendly and the food was great. So nice to be able to have fried chicken wings and hoagies again. The cleanest pizza shop I have ever been to. Even the bathrooms were clean! We will be going back.

XKqZd0ZBqnXi0XnnWs9sBQ.text: Hands down the best pizza in the city. Everything on the menu is fresh, homemade, and the portions are huge!! The Gluten free options are plentiful, and the best you can get anywhere. They also have a full allergen friendly menu with a very knowledgeable staff. The owner is one of the nicest you will find. We will drive out of our way just to eat here anytime we have a chance

wgM_TXYLyWrBfyIPvUJZmw.text: My review of any pizza place comes down to the quality and taste of the pizza. It maybe that Pastoli's has good service, and lots of gluten free options, but at the end of the day, this is very bad pizza, especially considering Napoli's is right down the block.   No reason to get a slice here if you're not gluten free.

9xsYcQfhXwKTroB1lg4oFA.text: I stopped by here a couple of Tuesday's ago with my wife and a friend for dinner.  The inside of Pastolis almost reminded me of a coffee shop with a lounge type area to the right with a couple of coolers and then seating throughout the rest of the restaurant.  To complete that coffee shop feel there seemed to be a guitar class or something like that being led by one of the employees in that lounge area.  For dinner on this evening our party of three decided to go with an XL cheese pizza and a small pizza with grilled chicken.  The pizza came out to our table after only a short wait and looked pretty good.  This pizza like all pizzas can be broken down into its three major components: crust, sauce and cheese.  I would consider the crust here to be medium sized although more towards the thin crust than to the thick.  As such the crust had a nice crispy crunch to it while the bottom had a softer texture.  The sauce on this pizza was what shines for me as it had a nice flavor to it although I couldn't tell you what herbs they were.  Last but not least was the cheese of which there was enough of it but it didn't really stand out for me.  The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future.  Pastoli's has one of the better non sweet sauces in Pittsburgh and I really enjoyed the crispy ends of the crust as well.

lYNrdFflZ7O_D8UEfJIPsw.text: Lots of great menu choices. We ordered an extra large Herbivore for 4 people. It was definitely a huge pizza. However...and this is the big one....the veggies were not at all the same as what was on the menu. It looked more like their veggie pizza. There were so many veggies I didn't like; by the time I picked through, I had very little pizza left. I'm the pickiest of the group. Just taken back a bit that it didn't really illustrate what was on the menu. We then had another issue with something "odd" in a slice. We called to explain what happened. We brought in the "item" and were credited. They did credit us with another pizza. We're just not yet ready to try again.

XcfEhtpwijpo24sF4VS89g.text: Everyone is always so friendly here, the staff is great and being knowledgable on  food allergies which is SO appreciated.   I like the casual flair of the interior, chalkboard menu, lots of food allergy friendly options as well as "regular". ASSIGNED ovens and fryers so there is no contamination.   My go to here is the GF Hoagie, Italian. If there is one thing my allergy makes me miss it's big messy Italian hoagies. And it never disappoints. Perfect level of crisp toasted texture from the bread without the gross heaviness abs texture some gf bread can have. Great amount of meat and cheese. So awesome, it's a great try! Maybe next time I come into the city from Greensburg I'll try the ravioli !

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sectional bigger than the one in my house
Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Casual interior with menu on the board :)

MPbaN_ZLl3tF4RYGEHfAIA.text: Great gluten free options for pizza and wings. The white pizza is amazing

8ToX4qX31KrSe7ym8ng2jw.text: Came here today and there was ONE person in the restaurant other than us.   Greeted with a less then friendly reception.  Followed by an even longer wait for 3 food items.   More than an hour for a chicken hoagie.    I'm not kidding.    The warm young man behind the counter who was tipped 20+ percent by the way - made no sincere apology or explanation for the wait.   The aggravation is not worth the gluten free options.     There are plenty of other options in the gluten free area.  Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

iAQkSDuWHmiQzdBVIzEnow.text: Good pizza. Good size. Delicious. Staff were friendly and good natured as well. I really enjoyed it - casual feel to it.

2uA2DtkyDU2onJbjcbCgHA.text: Our whole family loves Pastoli's!  They have great food and a wonderful family atmosphere.  The guitar jams and open mic nights are a lot of fun for all ages (literally all ages!).  Highly recommended.

yuWYlHV0MHXOaV68KNJivQ.text: I ordered from here via Grubhub. Usually, even good restaurants don't deliver high quality meals via grubhub- I suppose due to transportation time, transferring to boxes, etc. But this meal went above and beyond. I ordered spaghetti and meatballs because it was suggested. Thought it would be a usual simple spaghetti and meatballs, but it was beyond that. Somehow the sauce and the meatballs were just perfect. The meatballs were flavorful and moist, even when I reheated half of the meal the next morning. And the sauce was fantastic. Didn't taste too dry or too salty, which has been my experience with spaghetti and meatballs in the past. It came with salad and garlic bread, which surprised me because usually those cost extra. It surprised me even more that both were INCREDIBLE. I don't even like salads, but this one was great. I expected a few leaves and vegetables, but there were numerous vegetables, mozzarella cheese balls, and the blue cheese dressing was fabulous. I ordered jalapeno poppers too, and even those were great. Usually they just seem like cheap frozen ones that were reheated, but these ones were far better than that. Honestly just a way better meal than a drunk person ordering grubhub alone on a Saturday night deserves. I will be showing up in person sometime soon for sure!

Fdig-AeJjRnb5QPoamHJ4Q.text: Just ordered our first take out pizza from here.  Easy, friendly service. We got a 13" 8 piece pizza ($14 or so) with spinach and mushrooms. Pizza was ready within 15 mins and ready and waiting for us.  Pizza was fresh, hot and very good. A bit steep for the price but was well made.   I've also had the sicilan style pizza before here and it is super thick (as it should be) and very good.  Solid service and pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spinach and mushroom pizza 13&#34;

pd8l74EF3fZBjh6I2Q75pg.text: After the abominable Mandy's pizza closed, I was shocked to see Pastoli's go into here practically overnight.  Reluctant to try Pastoli's in case this was just an owner renaming, I finally stopped in here a few nights ago.  For a pizza place, Pastoli's is shockingly inviting.  There is a big comfy couch and tables.  My friend and I rolled in at 11:15 PM on a Saturday night.  The help was so nice, and our food came out super speedy.  We were instantly served cheese fries ($4.50) that were pretty standard.  We also got an extra large pizza with half tomato and half pineapple.  The crust was good, and they use a sweet sauce.  Toppings were an average amount.  While we did not need gluten free or other options, Pastoli's does cater to those with allergies, which is pretty cool.  Everyone who worked here was beyond pleasant in their interactions, and the pizza was quite good!  On top of that, as they close at midnight, the staff did not rush us at all.  Very impressed!

NlB-7ww0gkqsC5lBbJiCrQ.text: Their vegan pizza is really the only food in my diet I need for survival. It's amazing.

iBuye5Kvfb75GvBAtmxcVg.text: Pleasant atmosphere. Good food. Try the Chicken Pesto Rigatoni, very good. Large portions. Salad accompanying meal was large and good. Restauranteurs were helpful and helped with menu selection. For the money, it can't be beat. Hidden treasure in Squirrel Hill.

GHj_XfJUvFxYfiIucimH7Q.text: This place is a fantastic local pizza joint. We stopped by because of the large gluten free/allergy free menu and we're not disappointed; they even had a big gluten free beer selection! The gluten free crust is delicious and the regular crust looked even better. Yes, they can put fries on your pizza (I guess it's a Pittsburgh thing).   Overall we were very impressed by the level of customer service and the quality of the food. We highly suggest Pastoli's!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

u2vmVlNfb7iD12wy8NEuTA.text: This pizza place is seriously delicious! I love their specialty pizzas, my favorite being the buffalo chicken pizza. Also their breadsticks are so good. I've never tried their gluten free menu, but I think it is wonderful that you guys cater to dietary needs! Highly recommend!

uAP5R-jv0ea3XelE4cFbJA.text: The pizza felt and tasted like a frozen shell, the sauce had no flavor and the pepperoni was just cheap little circles. I also ordered onion rings which are $4.50, which was no where near what they should charge. I barely got any and again they were just frozen and fried.

h-Vg17A_is9CWnCMIr9vLQ.text: I ordered delivery over the weekend and it is possibly the best pizza in Pittsburgh!  I ordered a large pie, mozzarella sticks, fries, breadsticks, and an order of spaghetti and meatballs.  The only thing we weren't over the moon with were the mozzarella stick, but that's simply because we like it made a little differently.  The pizza and sauce was seriously so great.  I truly wish I tried them sooner.  They also delivered incredibly fast during the dinner hour which sort of shocked me.  I ordered through the Yelp app, so it was pretty easy!

ceVMn9I6XVI4qxr0_1BN0g.text: Traveled all the way across town because of reviews.  It was decent pizza but not the pizza I was hoping for.  Staff was nice.  Beer selection, salad, and wings were good.

8cCkve-i8PdAJrGEj2f0cw.text: Just ordered the vegan buffalo chicken pizza. This is by far the best vegan pizza I've had so far. Kudos for using all the right products. Everything is perfect. Can't wait to order more.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan buffalo chicken pizza.

hmkqwCb8UPzNdxDyH7j5uQ.text: The best gluten free pizza on the planet! You can customize it any way you want. They also have gluten free beer on tap + a large selection of other drinks and ciders. The staff is very friendly and helpful, they recommended other gf restaurants in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

YuUH6JtMlW9IgIOXEwSxFA.text: If I could give Pastoli's  and their Manager/Owner Chris a ZERO, I would. He messed up our order, delivered the wrong item. Then after calling the store an employee says they will correct the order. An hour passes- no delivery of correct item. We call back and Chris answers. He lies. Blames the customer for placing wrong order. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE for a loyal customer. Never will order from here again.

cnxBgLQ3fcUcVraM92fDEg.text: Ah man, I had no idea about this place until a friend and I were craving some pizza and she suggested it. We popped over one weekday evening for some vegan pie. Now, I am a buffalo chicken *loverrrrrr* but recently have been trying to pursue a vegan lifestyle. When she told me that they had a vegan buffalo chicken pizza I was hesitant but curious.   Wow, you definitely wouldn't be able to tell that it was vegan! We enjoyed our pizza there, piping hot, and were only able to finish one slice it was super filling. It even reheated well in the oven the next day!  This was my only visit there so far, but I cannot wait to go back and try the rest of their vegan options, as there were many!

A7aD58G3yIYhw6br9gpZbA.text: This is the best allergy friendly pizza (etc...) shop we have ever found.  Plus, it is just a great place to eat whether or not you need special prep. It is not sticks and berry vegan new age millennial trendy garbage, it is a joint.  They sell beer and hockey was on all of the televisions.  The owner had all ingredient list for my wife to see and made her feel safe about it.  The have great buns for the hoagies - I could honestly not tell the difference and a few options on the Pizza crust. A few choices on the cheese and on and on.  Sandy was able to get a pizza with pepperoni and some veggies, and got a steak hoagie to take home for lunch during the week.  While I was not limited to the allergy menu - I had a pizza with gluten and dairy!! All the great stuff - Crust was top notch, sauce was on point.  This is rare place that does both not only well - but five stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

q5q1EjUO453fRYZW5JJ_qw.text: This place is really great is you are looking for vegan and GF options in pizza comfort foods!  We had no idea this was here until we were searching for a new place for lunch. As a vegetarian, having vegan options for sandwiches and pizzas is amazing. I ordered a vegan wedgie and was a little disappointed in how tough the bread was. It was hard yet really chewy and just overall challenging to get through. I didn't let that stop me though because it was still delicious and I went back a second time!  The pizza is also really good. We had just a plain vegan cheese pizza and it surprisingly didn't taste like cardboard. It had good flavor and was very filling.   Staff were really nice and the wait was not long. Looking forward to trying more options!

uOb_fJkBgdltrkEn92coSQ.text: We ordered the tomato pesto mozz pizza for delivery - good crust but it didn't have much cheese on it and was kind of bland in general. Kind of disappointed, but would order something else next time!

osh8lfNHlHu0XGllHrEWRg.text: So I would say my pizza was a 3.5 but the fact that they have SO MANY OPTIONS for everyone they definitely get 4 stars, and the service was solid.  I got the buffalo chicken pizza on a Sicilian crust. I love Sicilian so finding some in Pittsburgh that are good is key. I enjoyed the crust however, (and maybe this is my fault) but the buffalo chicken on the thick crust was almost too much because they put french fries on the buffalo chicken pizza. I would definitely go back and try their regular pizza though for sure.   I also enjoyed that it didn't look like a pizza shop and there was a little group of people casually sitting in the couches playing instruments. Would definitely recommend to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

N_3C6jYlwGUUMmQgI5ywew.text: Pizza was fantastic. It had a thick perfectly cooked crust, crispy with a light char. The ingredients were fresh and delicious. This restaurant made it to the bookmarks!  The only issue we had was the driver who showed up without an ounce of change. So for my $24 total with tip included wasn't enough. I only had $40, so it was either an additional $16 tip or no pizza--not acceptable considering he said it was his last delivery?!?!

xD7KL93MagW2NMUEZa0Hqw.text: We stopped tonight and ordered about half the menu (for two people)... Gluten free white pizza (8 cut), fish dinner with fries, loaded buffalo gluten free fries, and gluten free cheese ravioli with a salad...  It was hands down the best gluten free pizza we've ever had! Great service! Highly recommend!

6poRGJsH9asjKv2oAohuBg.text: One of my favorite pizza spots and allergen friendly for those who are vegetarian, vegan or GF.

4_4drlB_8xT2KdpVwr1o_A.text: This place has the best Sicilian pizza in squirrel hill! I do wish they would actually add the toppings more equally all over the pizza as there are slices with no toppings sometimes. Other than that this is my go to pizza place!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Large Sicilian with crumbled sausage and onion

a8_fzt8ZMsJtL_XOTjHpbg.text: Fries on a sandwich, fries in a salad, fries on a PIZZA?!?  Well, I am curious, let's just give it a try won't we?  Why am I curious?  We are in Pittsburgh aren't we?  Look over the gourmet pizza's at Pastoli's and you will find that all of them have fries on top of them.  The Spicy bird is very spicy.  It comes complete with habanero mustard sauce and lot's of large slices of jalapeno's in every bite.  The baking of pizza in a 400 degree oven doesn't take away the zip of those jalapenos.  It is just too spicy and not interesting enough for me to be worth the bucks I have to shell out for pizza at Pastoli's.  You think they are being creative, but it is nothing that hasn't been done before in so many different places that it is a little bit tedious.  It is not the worst pizza, but it is not worth the extra money for pizza that is just an ordinary slice.     I took a look at the receipt and here is what it read, "glasses" Eat In.  This was there cute little way of remembering who I was because that night I wore glasses.  So, if someone heavyset who is tired and hungry comes in and orders a pizza, what do they put down?  Fat/Sleepy Eat In?  It is funny, but also, if I didn't have a sense of humor, down right offensive.   Oh, I had the vegan pizza, the regular kind is pretty lame.

1WxgaYezcZcIlmxAntM-IQ.text: I cannot say enough of Pastoli's or the people of Pastoli's! The gluten free pizza, salads, and especially the GF hoagies are fantastic. The regular menu is delicious, too, says my husband.   The restaurant itself is greatly taken care of and extremely family friendly. Awesome beer selection to boot.   The owner (I think there may be two but I've only met one) is a gem and one of the drivers in particular, Thomas, is just a favorite person of mine.   Fantastic all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Look at that GF bread!

PqoCATlVxG1vapXmX0XY3w.text: I wasn't aware of Pastoli's until a friend recommended I try it.  Every pizza place deserves a chance so I decided to see what makes this place any different than the scores of other pizza places located in the area. Anyone who is willing to enter the ring with Aiello's and Mineo's nearby earns my attention.   First impression:  It doesn't look like a pizza shop. The warm lighting and comfy seating throughout reminded me of a coffee cafe.  Never hurts to look inviting whatever you are selling.  I was quickly greeted and asked for my order.  I decided to go with a few slices of pizza they had ready.  I picked up the pizza box and immediately realized these are not wimpy weighing  slices at all.  I needed two hands to carry them!  The pizza tasted good and it is certainly worth another visit in order to try out some of the other menu selections.  Besides offering their traditional and specialty pizzas they serve a nice variety of  allergen-friendly, vegan, and gluten-free menu items.  More so than any other pizza  place I have seen.  The starters include fun things like corn puppies and the amazing queso sticks.  Salads, hoagies, wedgies, wings, calzones, pasta dishes are also available.  They even have a few dessert choices.  Caramel cinnamon puffs sounds like a nice finish to your meal.  I thank my friend for the recommendation and hope to return to Pastoli's soon.  I suppose a little competition never hurts anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

RGw9f9in4_SQNNxqZ4q_4g.text: When my parents are in town for holidays, I take full advantage. See, as a city dweller, I do not own a car. Like most city people. So when they visit, I use them and their vehicle to run errands; such as to the library to return a huge multitude of books. That's what took us to the squirrel hill neighborhood; and I can't wait to return to this place again and again.  First and foremost, for a little pizza eatery and beer shop, it has some kickbutt pizza. We opted for the Sicilian style; but they also have regular, gluten free, Allergen friendly, and vegan options (pizza, pasta, and many other choice of items too).  I picked up a single bottle of beer; though they offer 6 pack carry out beers too (mix your own or buy a non mixed 6 pack).  I'll be back many times as long as I live in the neighborhood!

ITsdGnxZr8e3WJ9-9X3fyA.text: Fast, friendly pizza place with lots of pizza options. My family liked the apex predator pizza, one for meat lovers. I had the Hawaiian, a favorite. Great way to take out and enjoy at home with family.

6an39yfpQL56wlUK7YU2Iw.text: A few years back I developed a dairy allergy and had to stop eating pizza across the board. With the exception of a special trip to Spak in Garfield, I had pretty much resigned myself to a pizza-less lifestyle. All that changed when I stumbled upon Pastoli's a few months back, and I cannot overstate how happy I am to be able to regularly order delicious pizza again!    They offer vegan cheese and an array of toppings on regular pizza crust (bruschetta and black olives are my favorites) but also have options for the gluten-intolerant and those of you who don't have dietary restrictions. The special pizza are prepared separately, so I never encounter issues with cross-contamination. They deliver via Grubhub, and my food has always arrived hot, fresh, and within a reasonable timeframe. (I live in Shadyside, so I'll admit I have an advantage there.) I hope Pastoli's sticks around for years to come, because I'm certain I'll be a loyal customer as long as I live in the area!

xlaHELiy-ppowkXxw1Z5Ww.text: This review is mostly in regards to value for money. The pizza itself was above average and it's great that they have vegan options BUT 30+ dollars for two small (i.e. slightly large personal pizzas) was a lot!   We did get delivery so that raises the price, but still that is very high! Still enjoyed the pizza I just wish we knew the size before we ordered.

4q_ohBOotkPyfatU8sX-tQ.text: Pastoli's is an average pizza joint. The pizza is somewhat rubbery of a texture but still is better than plenty of Pittsburgh pizza. Delivery through Grubhub is efficient. The wing flavors are solid, the cook on the wings, slightly above average.  If I could give this place 3.5 stars I would. It's better than most pizza options on Pittsburgh and Oakland but can not compare to Mineo's, Aiello's or even the non pizza campus deli.

qyR4tqNJL4iQcrsZZccXgg.text: I decided to try this restaurant despite my skeptical for vegan or gluten free pizza. I was surprised after I received my order.   Delivery timeliness 5/5 - it normally takes forever for me to receive my order in the my past from other restaurant   Pizza 4/5 - I only had their meat pizza and it was pretty good. One thing that pretty much made me give this place 4 instead of 3 is that it is not Oily at all!!! Can you believe it?! Non-Oily Pizza! It was the healthiest pizza I ever had.  Probably will go back again

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Meat Me on Murray Pizza
Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oil-less

Xqlr3rYjoltbQM_zEuZIUA.text: I've become a huge fan of this place.  I usually order the spaghetti and meatballs with garlic bread and a salad but today I thought I would continue to test the menu. I ordered a small white pizza and a order of loaded potatoe skins.  I picked it up in about 20 minutes and the white pizza was perfect. The dough was airy but not too thick, tomatoes were fresh and there was an ample amount of cheese. The potatoe skins stole the show though!  I've never had or even thought about deep frying my skins but obviously they have and it was amazing!  Seriously I would drive across the city just to get the potato skins

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small white pizza
Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Potatoe skins (deep fried I believe)
Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Garlic parm wings

9JkPO5wvILAOSIeaTd3Azg.text: My favorite pizza in Pittsburgh. This place was always tasty and the pizza was never greasy. We'd always get a huge half and half pizza (half Hawaiian and other half with pepperoni) that never disappointed. The price was right and there are coupons floating around on some of your grocery receipts. Anytime we had to go in to get the pizza the staff was friendly and working hard. Definitely a go-to pizza spot!

TIikg0ORQ81hh7ySzoj7qw.text: This place might be a hidden gem. Calzone was fresh and baked just right. The pizza was just as good. Such a solid choice if you are in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

INYiNbR0MhnIfRIsby-hrQ.text: Last Saturday I returned to see a friend play live music. A bunch of us went and got to enjoy the set along with March madness on in the background. I ordered a dozen wings split into 6 spicy lime and ) bbq. Both were great and came with ranch dipping sauce. I also got their grilled chicken salad. I don't typically have a healthy entree at a pizza place, but the salad was huge and filling. It also looked and tasted great. The staff brought the food out to my table and cleaned everything up for us at the end. Great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Live music tonight
Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Love music and calzoneeeee
Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Live performance, pizzas and beers

SIFJRngBD3eP1YJ6vccwfA.text: I loved it here! They had live music and it felt really authentic and nice. We did have to clear our own table so i think that could improve a little bit. We ordered the buff chick pizza and the buff chick wedgie. both were great! medium pizza is good to split with two people. we also ordered an order of garlic bread. it did take a bit once we ordered to get our food and i think that's from the delivery orders. it was a saturday night so we understood. overall really fun and we all loved our food and had plenty to take home (: will be back. i like better than Mineo's.

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo Chicken Pizza
Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo Chicken Wedgie

U0uZmrRTmEHetavFfymybA.text: Came in off the street because I was craving an Italian Hoagie. The staff was very nice and accommodating to my specifications about my sandwich. There was plenty of seating and they brought my sandwich to me. I got the half size and it was a very generous serving! The hoagie roll was toasted and delicious! Was only $6 it was fresh, well sized, and delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pastoli&#39;s Italian Hoagie with mayo instead of dressing

yewGUXCUTzMjmob05P4Yeg.text: great spot in Squirrel Hill for quality pizza, especially if you have friends with dietary restrictions in tow!  pastoli's pizza isn't just "good for pittsburgh," it's pretty good! two XL pizzas (crisp crust and generous toppings) and two orders of fries fed 12 of us for under $6 each including tip! beer in the fridge and plenty of vegan/gluten free/allergen free options as well (we came because our friend is vegan and loves the food!)   we came early on a saturday evening and the staff accommodated our group of 13, allowing us to move tables so we could sit together since it was mostly empty when we arrived. they were helpful, friendly and provided good service!  overall, pastoli's has great options for everyone in your group in a solid location at a reasonable price!

photos.caption: Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. pepperoni and sausage pizza (XL)
Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. veggie paradise pizza (XL)
Photo of Pastoli's Pizza, Pasta & Paisans - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. french fries - crispy outside, mealy on the inside! can also order with cheese/bacon

VZeNtKfO2re6rgpRCpkvPw.text: We were getting together for lunch with some friends, and after doing some research on places to pick up food in the area, we landed on Pastoli's. My wife is gluten-free, so she was excited that this place does a great job of offering lots of options for that. There's a gluten-free option for pretty much everything on their menu!  For lunch, we ordered a Sicilian pizza to share with friends, and a gluten-free pizza and wedgie for her. We brought it to our friends' house, and it all tasted great! The gluten-free crust was one of the better ones I've tried, and the regular pizza was really good and cheesy.  Great place for pizza, especially if you're gluten-free!

JiB9yKvfUoM25-Ycz7pnlg.text: I'm always skeptical when restaurants claim to have gluten free pizza. However, Pastoli's lived up to the hype. Their gluten free pizza tasted just like the real stuff and nothing like that cardboard tasting garbage you find at many other places. Definitely recommend for people with gluten free diets!

2_csBlw2ZmBrS0AcNRjZCw.text: I got the spaghetti and meatballs here and it was QUITE good!!!!! The meatballs were massive...... so I think that itself speaks for this review!!!!!! Haha!!!!!

DNexMSuhDiazI9kmQGuf0g.text: First time trying Yelp delivery service. Ordered delivery of pasta with meatballs, salad, and buffalo wings from this restaurant to a hotel we were staying at instead of ordering room service. The delivery order from this pizza and pasta restaurant failed to come with utensils (fork) and napkins to eat. Highly inconvenient as our hotel room had no utensils/kitchen and that's why we were ordering food. Ordering room service from the hotel would probably have been better.

bO3-Ys1fri2f_CLAOOh8BA.text: From the moment you open the door the smell of cheeses and good pizza dough hit you in the face! Some plush leather couches with accompanying oversized table are on the immediate right as you walk in.

0pVCQ5FOSRw89QzKqa2uww.text: So my mom, a self proclaimed pizza connoisseur, and I decided to get a pizza after a movie at the AMC Waterfront. This place has great reviews and decided to order online. We were going to pick up really quick and head back home, about 35 minutes with the traffic, back to South Park.  We picked up the pizza from one of the friendly staff, Mary Ann. We took our 2 pizzas and were on our way home.  About 10-15 minutes in to our drive I get a call. It's Mary Ann, telling us she gave us the wrong pizza! I didn't feel like driving back and adding 30 minutes of commute on to an already long day, so I told her don't worry about it. She informed me that one of the pizzas caught in the mix up was vegan, and she insisted on driving out to my place to give us the correct pizzas.   She showed up with the pizzas and was incredibly apologetic. I take my hat off to the wonderful customer service in correcting the mistake with the pizzas. It just proves that this is much more than an excellent pizza place, and they care deeply about the satisfaction of the customers.  The pizza is amazing here, and my mom loved it! I can't speak to the vegan pizza, as no one tried it. If you're in town, do yourself a favor and give this place a shot, you won't be disappointed! Also, give a shout out to Mary Ann, she is great!

S3VsKeZHXEbjbly39QusaA.text: Excellent pizza and chill environment! We had the Vegan Buffalo Chicken and the Vegan Veggie. Both were delicious! Love that they have bottled beer, too! We will be back soon! Highly recommend!

vMXHEczPbDZ2prOK6MFbow.text: Avoid at all costs. If I could give them 0 stars I would.   The order was wrong. When calling to get the order corrected person answering the phone was rude and refused to correct the issues. They even sent a salad to a hotel with no silverware and said silverware wasn't standard when delivering to a hotel. The food was overpriced and sub par quality. the $60 we were charged.

rtEZvTwHOUTLMaVuA2LX0Q.text: AMAZING VEGAN PIZZA! Normally vegan pizza is never as satisfying as real pizza was, but this pizza is awesome. Super delicious crust and cheese. I ordered the vegan buffalo chicken pizza, and I loved it, but I'm giving it 4 stars because it was so dang spicy - so if u dig that, you'll love it! Next time I'll just order it with less buffalo sauce.  Really happy and will definitely be back.

LZQnHvEm7uKT0QUqSBddbA.text: Really enjoyed this restaurant during a visit to Pittsburgh. The food is great and the owners were very nice. Try the gyro pizza and house salad.

F229OJbxAL6aVc1rAew7tg.text: Really good food. I've eaten here four or five times since moving to the area. I usually get hoagies, and their produce used is always fresh. Everyone there is really nice as well and they have a great atmosphere.

7KlgefvoBaKiNYurfHDpMw.text: First time eating at Pastolis and I had a great experience. Their basil pesto pizza is phenomenal and their chef salad has a great mix of vegetables and fresh deli meats and cheeses. Would definitely recommend to anyone east of downtown Pittsburgh looking for outstanding pies.

iWhyUinBDNOaArK1rs4qUg.text: Wonderful atmosphere, plenty of seats, fantastic service, delicious pizza, and clean! Can't wait to go back.

QK5103QUvPzgLHyIznFFBQ.text: I was pretty disappointed in my experience and surprised. I had read the reviews and heard my boyfriend say how much he'd enjoyed this place. So for my birthday I wanted a mellow night in and some yummy pizza. We ordered around the pizza around a quarter til 9/9pm. We ordered the feta and spinach pizza, with a couple of add-ons: tomatoes and onions. It was quoted to arrive around 945/950. Well, about 15 minutes before it was supposed to arrive the estimated time was changed and an additional hour was added. So when my boyfriend called back, they said it was about to head out the door. He checked to make sure our add-ons were included.. The pizza shows up at 11, barely warm and then the delivery guy complains at me to grab the pizza, to pay an additional $6 because they didn't include our add-ons, and then as we turn to shut the door, the delivery guy complains about the state of our road and how snowy it was (it wasn't). I was very disappointed in this experience, especially being new to the city and trying to find new places near me to be able to frequent.

VAUH0XLWXgGe5I2WNcdV5w.text: My buffalo chicken salad was prepared just as I asked (no onions) and was delicious.  The buffalo sauce was spicy, but not over-powering.  The chicken tenders were cooked perfectly.  The mixed greens are what a salad should be made of (not your typical iceberg mix from a bag).  My favorite part was the fresh mozzarella balls.   Chris and his staff truly want their customers to have a good dining experience and it shows in the quality food.  Bad days happen to everyone and that is how I would classify my first visit.  Today's experience was wonderful and they have earned a repeat customer!

gA4qscPtCm6HydYGG1FIzA.text: As a NY/NJ transplant to PGH who takes his pizza seriously I was always on the hunt for a great, simple pie. After recently being diagnosed lactose-intolerant that hunt was made even more complicated. Read about Pastolis and was excited to see pizza with dairy-free cheese. Walked in and split a pie with my boyfriend (also a NY/NJ transplant) and we were both instantly thrilled. Without a doubt the best crust on a pizza in PGH AND being allergen friendly makes Pastolis now my go-to for pizza. Great service, diverse set of toppings, and six packs to go! Will certainly be coming back.

wsEw7hmtnIk2RfboT3GZPg.text: We ordered 2 pizzas today, vegan and non vegan. After we got home, plated them and started to eat, I realized that my VEGAN PIZZA HAD REAL CHICKEN ON IT. I had my boyfriend examine and taste it, as he is non vegan, and he said it was REAL CHICKEN. I have eaten there numerous times, and have NEVER HAD AN ISSUE, but when I called today the girl taking the orders did not seem like the usual girl that is there, the nice one. We called them back and were told there is no chance it could be real chicken, no remedy was offered nor was an apology given, and she seemed bothered as well as no manager to take the phone from some one who has no customer service. It was like I was in The wrong. The vegan chicken is usually strips, and this was chunks of different sizes. Had I continued eating it, I would have gotten very sick, and the bbq sauce was very messy on it when it's usually very neat. I will not be going back, which is a shame

fphZzCApMJKmjndrQgEGsg.text: Excellent food and prices!   The pizzas are huge and very good.  Awesome selection.  Maryann and staff are always accommodating with large orders and specific pick up times.  I am happy a friend referred them and now it's my turn to spread the word!

jULXI3KqVQu6v5w87EBE2A.text: I've had Pizza several times and it is delicious and well worth the price which to me is reasonable.Toppings are plentiful and that's what I like.  I highly recommend it! Yummy!

4H4WQPR5Ou08zb3ltFa7Qw.text: Pastoli's is awesome. The whole restaurant has a very relaxed feel, while the variety and quality of the pizza is second to none. I highly recommend trying the specialty pizzas with lots of toppings. They are certainly worth it.

zCSaOebGZAjlbEQwxCFsWQ.text: Not only is the food just simply amazing. But, the staff are really friendly. They remember you and what you ordered last time. I highly recommend this place.

mKA5PXooN2IxmfGeW2IYpw.text: Finally a vegan pizza place that delivers to my house in Oakland!  I found this delicious place via Grubhub and couldn't believe how delicious my vegan pizza was!  I also got a lovely note with my breadsticks, letting me know that they were prepared without cheese and were vegan. (Thank you, The Pastoli's Vegan!) My only wish is for a vegan dessert option or two so I could finish off this delicious pizza with something sweet!

JQoL4EMuI_SVmokG88rs1w.text: Pizza is fantastic! My favorite is the white pizza, in my opinion it is by far the best. My friend who has celiac disease comes here with me and says that the gluten free food is top notch.

1oHmPVbRucrakwNbNx0Xmg.text: Cozy environment, great pizzas and friendly staffs. They even play soccer games on tv!

v33bM-KVuU-4dFceZltTSg.text: I love the turkey hoagie and the pizza (plain and bbq). My husband who is not GF wants to come here every time we're in the area for the buffalo chicken hoagie. Great place!!

FhG1AgMrhWuG42O7PwxCig.text: Our family stopped into Pastoli's while in town for a family event and had a great experience. Everything from the salads to the Tiramisu were very good. Loved the Gyro pizza!! The staff was very friendly and even came out to greet us and chat briefly during the meal.  We will definitely visit Pastoli's when in town again.

QmtN907vbXIvLOZ0XjyCpA.text: Friendly staff, large beer selection, REALLY good food.  Started with the mozzarella cheese sticks, large size with a tasty & crunchy batter.  Had the "Meat me on Murray" pizza with pepperoni, sausage, bacon, ham & salami. If you want a meaty pizza, this is it!  Oh, and save room for the Tiramisu, excellent!

brhbrfsye4k3upLAVypoAQ.text: Been ordering pizza from Pastoli's for the past year. Food has always been great. Today was the only time I left Pastoli's unsatisfied. My take out order on a Monday evening took an hour to prepare when the time frame given to me was under 30 minutes. No one in the staff communicated to me that my order was going to be delayed. I do love the pizzas here, but better communication would have made today's visit much less frustrating.

NB1Ks8cBNsTCrExKbiK2og.text: Pastoli's is a great place to grab a slice of pizza or some wings in Squirrel Hill - and especially if you're looking for a spot that offers items that are gluten free, vegan & dairy free, and allergy free. We ordered just from the gluten free and vegan menus, but you'll find a wide range of menu items from pizza and hoagies to wings, fries and other dinner offerings. I'll focus on our order: gluten free & vegan pizza (no gluten or dairy), gluten free wings, gluten free wedgie and two gluten free hoagies. First, I should point out that they were extremely helpful while ordering and very attentive to the specifics (gluten free, vegan, etc.). This is a very welcoming business. I didn't wait very long for the order and they got everything right - no mistakes. As for the food - very good. Very nice GF pizza crust and rolls. Wings are excellent. We'll definitely be back. I'll add that Pastoli's is easily found along Murray Ave and there's a nice area with tables if you'd like to eat in. They do take out and delivery too. If you're gluten free, this is a very cool place.

vtyjUf1LOkpdGJabZQW_kA.text: Went here after a recommendation from Gluuteny across the street. I wish I had caught the name of the super friendly woman who took our order. Delicious gluten free pizza that even my non-GF boyfriend enjoyed, comfy couch, great beer (GF and gluten-full) selection! I am a big sauce lover, too, and Pastoli's did not disappoint! Can't wait to go back next time I'm in town!

TJeelYSph9TXYfC8WShs6g.text: I ordered two slices to go.  Twenty five minutes later when I  was hungry and still waiting I asked for my money back.  I was told they had cooked them and would not be given my money back.  Anyone who goes there customer service is a joke.  Six people working there, 1 table of customers and they can't come up with two cuts???    I cant wait to see this place go out of business!     In responding to business owner Chris R's rebuttal..... he agrees that his restaurant was at fault in not telling me how long it would be to receive an order of two cuts to go.   There were not even 10 people in the restaurant at any time of my wait that was at least 25 minutes for two cuts!!  And the man would not give me my money back when I told him I was tired of waiting?   As I live in Sq Hill I have gone out of my way to relate this experience to friends and family as to how out of line you were.  You lost more than 20 peoples business already and that number will grow.  Enjoy the $4.50!!!

qo-9cxJ2nrSupAyflH0r3Q.text: Best Gluten free pizza I have ever had.  The owner was so friendly and helpful.  They had so many different options too!  Best part is they have g free desserts from the gluten free bakery up the street.  I will definitely be back!

QRMc-07TWEjZKpOGj3qS8Q.text: Have been in search of great GF vegetarian pizza in The 'Burgh for some time.  Finally! Ate here last night & loved the GF pizza!  Kind, attentive & personal service as well. A+.

EXILRHLQhCQv22-1ljGCeA.text: So great that there is a restaurant that cares so much about Allergies.  Food was fantastic and staff was very nice and friendly.  Great beer selection as well.
